alert.note: Alert for Bronx; Kings; Nassau; New York (Manhattan); Queens (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 20 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New York, including the following counties, Bronx, Kings (Brooklyn), Nassau, New York (Manhattan) and Queens. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 345 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jamaica, Flatbush, Flushing, Mott Haven, East Tremont, Coney Island, Rockaway Beach, Great Neck, Crown Heights, Laguardia Airport, RFK Bridge, Kennedy Airport, Throgs Neck Bridge, Midtown Manhattan, The Verrazano Narrows Bridge, Harlem, Jackson Heights, Forest Hills, Canarsie and Bay Ridge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Bronx; Kings; Nassau; New York (Manhattan); Queens
